title: What ‘Diversity and Inclusion’ Can Conceal
sub_head: The Democratic Party seems more like a coalition of disparate groups.
body:
Reading Daniel Henninger’s “Joe Biden’s Cabinet of Diversity” (Wonder Land, Dec. 17), I was reminded of parliamentary governments around the world. Often no party gets a majority of seats and a coalition must be built to get a prime minister. In building the coalition, cabinet posts are often used as barter.
Is that what Joe Biden is doing now? The Democratic Party seems more like a coalition of disparate groups. As Will Rogers once said, “I am not a member of any organized party. I’m a Democrat.”
John L. Hoh Jr.
Beloit, Wis.
